name: Week 2 - Code Quality & Documentation Evaluation
description: Comprehensive evaluation rubric for code repositories and PDF reports

dimensions.name: code_organization
dimensions.description: Evaluate code structure, modularity, and organization patterns
dimensions.forensic_instruction: Analyze repository structure: check for module separation, file organization, and architectural patterns. Look for clear separation of concerns, consistent naming conventions, and logical grouping of related code.
dimensions.judicial_logic: Score based on modularity (40%), naming conventions (30%), and separation of concerns (30%). Consider Python package structure, imports organization, and code reuse patterns.
dimensions.synthesis_rules: Integrate code organization findings with documentation quality assessment. Highlight patterns that affect both code structure and documentation clarity.

dimensions.name: documentation_quality
dimensions.description: Evaluate README completeness and inline documentation
dimensions.forensic_instruction: Extract and analyze README content: check for setup instructions, API documentation, usage examples, and contribution guidelines. Scan Python files for docstrings and inline comments.
dimensions.judicial_logic: Score based on completeness (40%), clarity (30%), examples (20%), and maintenance (10%). README should have badges, installation, quick start, API reference, and contribution guide.
dimensions.synthesis_rules: Correlate documentation quality with code organization. Well-documented code often indicates good organization practices.

dimensions.name: pdf_analysis
dimensions.description: Analyze PDF report structure and content quality
dimensions.forensic_instruction: Extract sections, tables, figures, and key findings from PDF. Identify report structure: abstract, methodology, results, conclusions. Extract data from tables and charts where possible.
dimensions.judicial_logic: Evaluate based on structure (30%), data visualization (30%), conclusions clarity (20%), and reproducibility (20%). Check if findings are supported by data.
dimensions.synthesis_rules: Synthesize PDF findings with any code evidence. Cross-reference report claims with actual implementation if available.

dimensions.name: image_analysis
dimensions.description: Analyze diagrams, screenshots, and visual elements
dimensions.forensic_instruction: Extract images from PDF or documentation. Analyze diagrams for clarity, completeness, and relevance. Check for architecture diagrams, flowcharts, and screenshots.
dimensions.judicial_logic: Score based on clarity (40%), relevance (30%), and completeness (30%). Good visuals should be readable, labeled, and support the text.
dimensions.synthesis_rules: Connect visual findings with textual documentation. Visuals should complement and clarify written content.

synthesis_rules.combine_findings: Merge evidence from all sources into coherent narrative
synthesis_rules.weighted_scoring: Calculate final scores based on dimension weights
synthesis_rules.executive_summary: Generate 3-5 bullet points of key findings
